intro: Aporosa penangensis, commonly known as Penang aporosa, is a flowering plant species native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in lowland forest understories and is often found in humid, shaded environments. Aporosa penangensis is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and potential ecological significance.
